intro: Silene gymnotheca, commonly known as the naked-cup catchfly, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its simple, often hairy stems and small, pinkish to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Silene gymnotheca produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
